dcterms:creator: T. A. Enßlin
H. Junklewitz
L. Winderling
M. Greiner
M. Selig
dcterms:description: The CURE method is a calibration uncertainty renormalized estimator that reconstructs a signal and simultaneously the instrument’s calibration from the same data without knowing the exact calibration, but its covariance structure.
dcterms:title: CURE (Calibration Uncertainty Renormalized Estimator)

dcterms:creator: T. A. Enßlin
M. Frommert
F. S. Kitaura
dcterms:description: Information Field Theory (IFT) provides a framework for understanding the statistical properties of signals and their calibration.
dcterms:title: Information Field Theory (IFT)

dcterms:creator: C. Osborne
dcterms:description: Calibration methods are statistical techniques used to improve the accuracy of measurements by adjusting for systematic errors.
dcterms:title: Calibration Methods

dcterms:creator: T. A. Enßlin
M. Frommert
dcterms:description: The CURE Method is an advanced calibration technique that incorporates calibration uncertainties into signal inference equations.
dcterms:title: Calibration Uncertainty Renormalized Estimator (CURE) Method

dcterms:creator: N. Wiener
dcterms:description: The Wiener Filter is a statistical filter used to produce an estimate of a desired signal by suppressing noise.
dcterms:title: Wiener Filter

dcterms:creator: N. Metropolis
A. W. Rosenbluth
M. N. Rosenbluth
A. H. Teller
E. Teller
dcterms:description: Markov Chain Monte Carlo (MCMC) methods are used for sampling from probability distributions based on constructing a Markov chain.
dcterms:title: MCMC (Markov Chain Monte Carlo)

dcterms:creator: M. Selig
M. R. Bell
H. Junklewitz
N. Oppermann
M. Reinecke
M. Greiner
C. Pachajoa
T. A. Enßlin
dcterms:description: NIFTy is a software package designed for statistical inference in astrophysics and cosmology.
dcterms:title: NIFTy
